intro: Hasslerella rojasii, commonly known as the Rojas' alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine regions. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and is adapted to cold, harsh climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
